v8:item.v8:content: Choosing this option lets you upload new transactions from a text CSV file. Every line in the CSV file describes a transaction in the following format: Date (DD/MM/YYYY), Description (any string), Amount (digits with the dot)
Choosing this option lets you upload new transactions from a text CSV file.
Choose whether to create a new document (Add) or match with an existing one (Match)

Settings.QueryText: SELECT InformationRegisterBankTransactions.TransactionDate, InformationRegisterBankTransactions.BankAccount, DocumentJournal1.Company, InformationRegisterBankTransactions.ID, InformationRegisterBankTransactions.Description, InformationRegisterBankTransactions.Amount, InformationRegisterBankTransactions.Category, InformationRegisterBankTransactions.Document, NOT DocumentJournal1.Ref.AutoGenerated AS Match, InformationRegisterBankTransactions.Accepted, InformationRegisterBankTransactions.Hidden, InformationRegisterBankTransactions.OriginalID, InformationRegisterBankTransactions.YodleeTransactionID, InformationRegisterBankTransactions.Class, InformationRegisterBankTransactions.Project, InformationRegisterBankTransactions.PostDate, InformationRegisterBankTransactions.Price, InformationRegisterBankTransactions.Quantity, InformationRegisterBankTransactions.RunningBalance, InformationRegisterBankTransactions.CurrencyCode, InformationRegisterBankTransactions.CategoryID, InformationRegisterBankTransactions.Type, InformationRegisterBankTransactions.CategorizedCompanyNotAccepted, InformationRegisterBankTransactions.CategorizedCategoryNotAccepted, "Undo" AS Unaccept FROM InformationRegister.BankTransactions AS InformationRegisterBankTransactions LEFT JOIN DocumentJournal.DocumentJournal1 AS DocumentJournal1 ON InformationRegisterBankTransactions.Document = DocumentJournal1.Ref WHERE InformationRegisterBankTransactions.BankAccount = &AccountInBank AND InformationRegisterBankTransactions.Accepted = TRUE
